intro: Euphorbia fulgens, commonly known as the flame tree, is a striking plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, featuring a thick, woody stem and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright orange to red cyathia, which are its modified flower structures, often mistaken for flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Euphorbia fulgens is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
